    • Multi-trait SuSiE with interaction terms

    Estimate a multi-trait Sum of Single Effect regression model

    fit_mt_susie.Rd

    Estimate a multi-trait Sum of Single Effect regression model

    fit_mt_susie(
  x,
  y,
  levels = 15L,
  max_iter = 100L,
  min_iter = 1L,
  coverage = 0.9,
  tol = 1e-04,
  prior_var = 0.1,
  lodds_cutoff = 0,
  min_pip_cutoff = NULL,
  full_stat = TRUE,
  stdize_lbf = FALSE,
  local_residual = FALSE
)

    Arguments

    x

    design matrix

    y

    output matrix

    levels

    number of "single" effects

    max_iter

    maximum iterations

    min_iter

    minimum iterations

    tol

    tolerance

    prior_var

    prior variance

    lodds_cutoff

    log-odds cutoff in trait selection steps

    min_pip_cutoff

    minimum PIP cutoff in building credible sets

    full_stat

    keep full statistics

    stdize_lbf

    trait-wise standardize LBF

    local_residual

    locally calculate residuals

    Value

    a list of mtSusie results

    alpha

    Posterior probability of variant across p x level

    resid.var

    residual variance level x traits

    prior.var

    prior variance 1 x traits

    log.odds

    log-odds ratio level x traits

    mu

    a list of p x m mean parameters

    var

    a list of p x m variance parameters

    lbf

    a list of p x m log-Bayes Factors

    z

    a list of p x m z-scores

    n

    number of samples

    m

    number of traits/outputs

    p

    number of variants

    L

    number of layers/levels

    cs

    credible sets (use data.table::setDT to assemble)

    In the cs, we have

    variants

    variant indexes [1 .. p]

    traits

    trait indexes [1 .. m]

    levels

    levels [1 .. L]

    alpha

    shared PIP

    mean

    univariate mean

    var

    univariate var

    z

    univariate z-score

    lfsr

    local false sign rate

    lodds

    log-odds ratio

    Contents

    Developed by Yongjin Park.
